newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Balkan, Black Sea firms to discuss energy projects.
newsitem.headline: Balkan, Black Sea firms to discuss energy projects.

text.p: Balkan and Black Sea state and private firms will seek to attract potential investors in the construction of new gas and oil pipelines in the region at a conference in Sofia in September, officials said on Thurdsay.

"For the first time a complete picture will be presented of all existing and planned new gas and oil pipelines in the region at a conference to be held September 17-19," said Valentin Kanev, Executive Director of the Balkan and Black Sea Petroleum Association (BBSPA), which is organising the conference.
Russia's Gazprom is expected to discuss Trans-Balkan and Black Sea gas transmission options and Rosneft's report will focus on oil exports from Black Sea oil terminals, Kanev said.
He said that a number of banks and big private firms had already registered to participate in the conference, including Deutsche Bank and Russia's LUKoil.
BBSPA members include state gas and oil companies of Balkan countries, as well as BG Plc, Texaco and Enterprise Oil, he said.

Russia, Bulgaria and Greece plan a route carrying oil by tanker from Russia's Black Sea port of Novorossiisk to the Bulgarian Black Sea port of Bourgas and then pumped through a pipeline to Alexandropoulis in Greece.

Under another project of the Albanian, Macedonian and Bulgarian Oil Corporation (AMBO), the crude will be carried from Russia, Kazakhstan and Azerbaijan by tanker to Bourgas and then transported via Bulgaria, Macedonia and Albania to Brindisi in Italy.

Russia's Gazprom and Bulgaria, which has a 2,000 km gas pipeline network, are considering an enlargement of a pipeline on Bulgarian territory transiting Russian gas to Turkey, as well as Russian gas supplies to other Balkan countries.
